benchmark_details.name: UAL-Bench (Unusual Activity Localization Benchmark)
benchmark_details.overview: UAL-Bench is a comprehensive benchmark for unusual activity localization in videos, featuring three data sets: UAG-OOPS, UAG-SSBD, UAG-FunQA, and an instruction-tune dataset OOPS-UAG-Instruct to improve model capabilities.

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: To evaluate models' capabilities in localizing unusual activities in videos and to outline challenges in current methodologies.

data.source: Three datasets: UAG-OOPS, UAG-SSBD, UAG-FunQA, and one instruction-tune dataset OOPS-UAG-Instruct.
data.size: 1,589 videos for UAG-OOPS, 75 videos for UAG-SSBD, 172 videos for UAG-FunQA, 3,778 videos for OOPS-UAG-Instruct.
data.annotation: Annotations include start and end timestamps for activities.

methods: Integration of Vision-Language Models and Large Language Models (VLM-LLM)
methodology.calculation: Performance is evaluated based on the localization metrics that measure how well predicted timestamps overlap with ground truth.
methodology.interpretation: Higher R@1 and lower mTD indicate better performance.
methodology.baseline_results: Random method as a baseline which serves as a lower performance indicator.
methodology.validation: Proposed evaluation protocol includes zero-shot settings.
